summary.p: The Nālaṭiyār, complete text with commentary (U2b), preceded by satellite material (U2a).
U2a ends with a date: 30 May 1822 (U2a, f1r6).
U2b ends with a colophon with date: 12 May 1823 (U2b, f100r1).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (July 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

msItem.title: Nālaṭiyār: Mūlam & Urai
msItem.finalRubric: In-text chapter completion statements. See selection below.

collation.desc: 3 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
1 folio = Nālaṭiyār: Satellite Stanzas. No foliation. Verso blank.
100 folios = Nālaṭiyār: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-100. f100v blank.
2 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso, except one unblackened line on f[2]r.

supportDesc.condition: Good condition with some worm-holes; partly unblackened towards the end.

handNote.desc: Transitional script with modern ṟa, kompu with mini second loop. U2b not entirely blackened.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 973 covering a previous shelfmark (front cover, recto).
In-text intertitles in chapter completion statements. See selection below.

binding.p: Original wood covers. With wooden stick in one of the hole. The single string is attached to the stick.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year cittirapāṉu (copy beginning statement, U2a, f[1]v6) and to the year cupāṉu (colophon, U2b, f100r1) of the Jovian cycle, that is, respectively, 30th May 1822 and 12th May 1823.

acquisition.p: From Émile Senart (1847-1928). See Cabaton (1912), handwritten addition, f. 4r, no. 973, which gives the shelfmark Senart 311, which does not match in Filliozat (1936).

listBibl.bibl: Nālaṭiyār. 1921. Camaṇamuṉivarkaḷ iyaṟṟiya Nālaṭiyār mūlamum teḷiporuḷ viḷakkamum. uraiyāciriyar Vai. Mu. Caṭakōparāmānujācāriyar/Cē. Kiruṣṇamācariyar. iraṇṭām patippu. Ceṉṉai: Śrī Kaṇēc Accukkūṭṭam.
Nālaṭiyār. 1964. Patiṉeṇkīḻkkaṇakku Nālaṭiyār urai. uraiyāciriyar Ti. Cu. Pālacuntaram Piḷḷai. Reprint. Ceṉṉai: Kaḻakam. [1st ed. 1945, rep. 1949, 1953, 1957, 1961]

Nālaṭiyār. 1980. Nālaṭiyār uraivaḷam (mūlamum mūṉṟu paḻaiya uraikaḷum aṭaṅkiyatu). 2 vols. patippāciriyarkaḷ S. Mutturatṉa Mutaliyār/M.R. Kantacāmi Piḷḷai. 2nd edition. Tañcāvūr: Makārājā Cāpōjiyiṉ Caracuvati Makāl Nūl Nilayam. [1st ed. 1953]

Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See handwritten addition in BnF copy (shelfmark “8°-Impr Or-720”), f. 4r, no. 973.
Filliozat, Jean. 1936. Etat des manuscrits de la collection Emile Senart. Journal Asiatique, Tome 228, 127-143 — See p. 141.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: First version. Converted to TEI by Charles LI.

Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, July 2022. With the kind help of Giovanni Ciotti (Hamburg University) & Marco Franceschini (Bologna University) for deciphering and interpreting the dates in the copy beginning statement and in the colophon.
